name: Green Thai Shrimp Curry
author: Lorraine Williams
summary: This very tasty and easy Thai shrimp dish is great for entertaining. I served it over baked brown rice with raisins and crushed peanuts.
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon hot pepper flakes, or more to taste
2 tablespoons green curry paste (such as Thai Kitchen®)
1 small red bell pepper, halved and cut into slivers
1 pound medium cleaned raw shrimp, or more to taste
directions: Pour 1 tablespoon peanut oil into a large skillet over medium heat
Add onion, garlic, ginger, and hot pepper flakes
Stir and cook until onions are tender, about 5 minutes
Add remaining oil and green curry paste
Stir and cook about 1 more minute
Add celery and red bell pepper to the skillet with the onion mixture
Continue cooking and stirring until tender-crisp, 3 to 5 minutes
Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until reduced by 75%, about 10 minutes
Add shrimp to the skillet with the curry and cook until they turn pink, about 2 minutes
Season with fish sauce and cilantro
